summary: Ann Furnald Taylor was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications indicating that she was employed by the committee from at least February 1977 through December 1977. The payroll certifications list her name and salary, confirming her employment during that period. The specific role or responsibilities of Ann Furnald Taylor within the HSCA are not detailed in these documents, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member contributing to the committee's work.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Ann Furnald Taylor's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, which was tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the exact nature of her contribution is not specified in these documents, her employment indicates she was involved in the committee's operations during its investigation.
